g.title:
<
5. Qa4+
Blocking the attack with both
the Bd7 (black Queen cut off
from attacking d5 pawn, b7 is
unprotected after white Queen
drops back to b3) and Qd7
(trouble after Bb5) leads to
problems, correct move is5. .. Nd7
block; white continues with
6. Nc3 , black can not kick the
white Queen with a6 b5 because
Bxb5 looses the black rook.
Black continues with6. .. g6
7. Nf3 Bg7 8. Bc4

>
g.text: from attacking d5 pawn, b7 is
drops back to b3) and Qd7
white Queen with a6 b5 because

g.title:
<
8. Qb3 drop back
white Queen drops back as
black king will castle soon,
pin is lost;8. .. 0-0 9. Bc4

opens up for Nc5 - Ne4 - Nd6
sequence -- nicely tucked away
knight behind the IQP, or
alternatively Bf5 can be
played if Qc2 instead of Qa3

>
g.text: opens up for Nc5 - Ne4 - Nd6
played if Qc2 instead of Qa3

g.title:
<
5. Qa4+
Blocking the attack with both
the Bd7 (black Queen cut off
from attacking d5 pawn, b7 is
unprotected after white Queen
drops back to b3) and Qd7
(trouble after Bb5) leads to
problems, correct move is5. .. Nd7
block; white continues with
6. Nc3 , black can not kick the
white Queen with a6 b5 because
Bxb5 looses the black rook.
Black continues with6. .. g6
7. Nf3 Bg7 8. Bc4

>-><
8. Qb3 drop back
white Queen drops back as
black king will castle soon,
pin is lost;8. .. 0-0 9. Bc4

opens up for Nc5 - Ne4 - Nd6
sequence -- nicely tucked away
knight behind the IQP, or
alternatively Bf5 can be
played if Qc2 instead of Qa3

>

<
white pawn on d5
mainLine
moves 3. exd5 cxd5 4. cxd5
Nf6

if Queen takes it can be
harassed easily by white for
good development and IQP with
good look outs; advised move
is Nf6

>
g.text: if Queen takes it can be

g.title:
<
white pawn on d5
mainLine
moves 3. exd5 cxd5 4. cxd5
Nf6

if Queen takes it can be
harassed easily by white for
good development and IQP with
good look outs; advised move
is Nf6

>-><
5. Qa4+
Blocking the attack with both
the Bd7 (black Queen cut off
from attacking d5 pawn, b7 is
unprotected after white Queen
drops back to b3) and Qd7
(trouble after Bb5) leads to
problems, correct move is5. .. Nd7
block; white continues with
6. Nc3 , black can not kick the
white Queen with a6 b5 because
Bxb5 looses the black rook.
Black continues with6. .. g6
7. Nf3 Bg7 8. Bc4

>

<
5. Bb5+
Block with5. .. Nd7 6. Nc3
a6 to kick the bishop. If 7.
Be2 that equalises for black
with several options to attack
the d5 pawn and kick the
knight on c3 after 7. .. b5 so
white usually plays7. Qa4 Rb8 8.
Bxd7 Bd7 white plays 8. Bxd7 to
not to loose tempi.



after white Queen drops back
to b3 or moves over to f4
black can push b pawn to kick
Nf3 knight and/or e7 and
equalise or get better if dxe7
Bxe7
>
g.text: the d5 pawn and kick the
knight on c3 after 7. .. b5 so
to b3 or moves over to f4
black can push b pawn to kick
equalise or get better if dxe7

g.title:
<
white pawn on d5
mainLine
moves 3. exd5 cxd5 4. cxd5
Nf6

if Queen takes it can be
harassed easily by white for
good development and IQP with
good look outs; advised move
is Nf6

>-><
5. Bb5+
Block with5. .. Nd7 6. Nc3
a6 to kick the bishop. If 7.
Be2 that equalises for black
with several options to attack
the d5 pawn and kick the
knight on c3 after 7. .. b5 so
white usually plays7. Qa4 Rb8 8.
Bxd7 Bd7 white plays 8. Bxd7 to
not to loose tempi.



after white Queen drops back
to b3 or moves over to f4
black can push b pawn to kick
Nf3 knight and/or e7 and
equalise or get better if dxe7
Bxe7
>

<
white's option 1 5. Nc3
mainLine
5. .. Nxd5 6. Nf3 Nxc3 7.
bxc3 g6 8. d4 Bg7 9. Bd3 O-O
10. O-O Nc6 11. Re1 ; where Bg4 can
be played, exchanging the
bishop for the knight or e5
pawn sacrifice to uncover
weaknesses on the queens side
with Qa5 later

>
g.text: bxc3 g6 8. d4 Bg7 9. Bd3 O-O
bishop for the knight or e5

mainLine
5. .. Nxd5 6. Nf3 Nxc3 7.
bxc3 g6 8. d4 Bg7 9. Bd3 O-O
10. O-O Nc6 11. Re1 ; where Bg4 can
be played, exchanging the

pawn sacrifice to uncover
weaknesses on the queens side
with Qa5 later

>

<
The accelerated panov
variation
1. e4 c6 2. c4 d5
>

<
The accelerated panov
variation
1. e4 c6 2. c4 d5
>-><
white pawn on d5
mainLine
moves 3. exd5 cxd5 4. cxd5
Nf6

if Queen takes it can be
harassed easily by white for
good development and IQP with
good look outs; advised move
is Nf6

>

<
regular panov and transposing
into regular from accelerated
regular panov is 1. e4 c6 2.
d4 d5 3. exd5 cxd5 4.c4; which
can accelarated panov can
transpose into via 1. e4 c6 2.
c4 d5 3. exd5 cxd5 4. d4

>

<
The accelerated panov
variation
1. e4 c6 2. c4 d5
>-><
regular panov and transposing
into regular from accelerated
regular panov is 1. e4 c6 2.
d4 d5 3. exd5 cxd5 4.c4; which
can accelarated panov can
transpose into via 1. e4 c6 2.
c4 d5 3. exd5 cxd5 4. d4

>
